9/10

It is a good game but after a year the bugs aren't acceptable anymore. Trouble with the matchmaking. Hard to find a match as survivor. Loosing offerings and rank when the killer disconnects (loved by troll killers). Killer just using downloads during the match to cause lags for the survivors.

I really enjoy the game but I don't have the time to restart the matchmaking 20 times or even the whole game just to get into a lobby where the killer just closes the lobby again.

Get a proper matchmaking or your whole  playerbase will be gone soon. 

I can't recommend this game on its actual state.

The game is fun, the concept is nice. 

Bugs are plenty, no balance and each update bring more issues than it solves. 
Why the small amount of number of hours? 3 months of not playing the game due to a bug preventing me to start it, no dev support on the forums. I do feel i was robbed of the 20 eur i paid for it just by having the game in the library and being able to play it.

PS: better release a new DLC than fix some bugs.

My feelings in a nut shell >>> My MMR is too high and now I can't have fun.
The killer is forced to proxy camp, tunnel and in general sweat his/her ass off to stand a chance, and frankly I don't find that fun.
I want to be able to find new survivors, have a chase and give everyone a fun game; myself included.
But alas, that is not a possibility with the current state of the game.
You instantly lose by not bringing gen slow down.
You instantly lose by getting a bad map (FML Nurse on Lery's is the biggest meme of a guessing game)
The 'strongest' killers are the ones with mobility - Nurse, Bouncy boi, Otaku-bitch; and that's because they have a level of unpredictability. They have a power that allows them to catch the survivors off guard.
God forbid you're playing a killer that walks, turns out moving a mesely 15% faster then survivors makes you very predictable and gives the survivor complete control, who knew?!
Walking towards a survivor just doesn't cut it.

I guess I'll occasionally hold M1 and Shift+W with some friends and pray things pick up.

Although there're too many bugs, the server sucks, and the game is not friendly to a PC with low FPS and low quality, I still like playing this game with my friends. I really hope the DEVs are gonna do some good jobs in the future but not something like 'I think we've done a pretty good job so far'.

Il gioco in se è divertente, l'idea 4vs1 dove i sopravissuti devono riparare generatori e il killer li deve uccidere tutti mi attira molto. Purtroppo questo gioco ha troppi , troppi , troppi bug.. non è un gioco, è un bug! Gli sviluppatori pensano piu a collaborazioni e bug fixes e fanno degli aggiornamenti che rovinano il gioco, per poi togliere le stesse funzioni aggiunte nell'aggiornamento successivo. Però devo dire che il gioco rimane bilanciato anche per chi non ha i dlc perche si possono comunque avere i perk dei nuovi personaggi tramite le relique... beh da un parte lo sconsiglio, dall'altra lo consiglio

This game is fairly fun at lower ranks of the ingame ranking system, not so much at higher ranks. If youre playing alone Id recommend playing for fun instead of playing seriously until you get a good grasp on how things work. If with friends, be prepared for the killers not wanting to play against your groups, its one on four and the killer is alone without anyone to talk to for help.

That being said, be nice and respectful, both sides. These are real people playing along side you.

mid game, bad developers

Current GPU is not good enough to have decent FPS but this game is still hella fun. 

Even with 13-15 fps i still find the game to be fun as the killer. The game provides enough clues to keep on a survivors trail, provided you don't over think their escape. It is crazy how easy i can be to overlook people hiding in plain sight, but it is equally rewarding to catch people doing it XD. I was a little bit thrown off but how long it takes to fully kill the survivors at first but then I got better at the game and realized it makes the game mo better, nothing more rewarding than getting the final hook on someone that has Barry Sanders'd your ass all game :D

Playing as a survivor for the first time was scary as hell, until I learned how to hide myself correctly. Think outside the box and hide in plain sight! Oh wait! Sometimes it is luck the killer doesnt see you, sometimes you hide in the areas your current killer hasnt been patrolling. Im god awful as the survivor, I freak when the skill check happens, thanks Devs <3, i am always amazed when I land enough in a row to almost have the generator fully repaired and slip up right before it is fully repaired T.T. one day my FPS will be decent and my skill checks will be on point, but until then ima keep on freaking!!

P.S. some mother kluckers get a little too fresh with pallets or windows when you are the killer and it can suck but you have to remember there are other people repairing generators so stop wasting your time with mofos that are playing you and slay their less bold buddies, the cocky bastids will always slip up sometime later :D

P.P.S. it can take a bit to load a game in solo que, my tip for getting around that is clicking on survive with friends, exiting out of the friends list that pops up, readying up, waiting for the game start timer to count down and have it throw you into a lobby within a minute. Otherwise have fun waiting 10-30 minutes for a the game to throw you into a lobby from the main menu survive alone option

On paper this game should be awesome, but it isn't.

The idea where there is a killer (tank-ish) and you are hunting survivors sounds awesome. However in the execution is where this game falls apart.

When you are the killer, you're suppose to be this unstoppable monster that is something to be feared. The reality is that you couldn't kill a fly. You can only down the other players, once downed you must then hang them on a post, where after a long period of time they will die. Yes, you can't actually kill anything yourself. Even when you get someone with your chainsaw you only down them.

It wouldn't be so bad if it actually meant something to be placed on the post/alter. It takes somewhere around 2 minutes for someone to die on it. That might not seem like much but the objective for the survivors is to turn on 5-6 engines. You can either go after those survivors or watch your "hung" survivor die. I bring this up because it is painfully easy for someone to get off the post once they've been placed there. Either they have a perk, or they have another player get them down. In which case after a quick heal it's like they were never downed.

This would be forgivable if there was actually any tension in the game, but again there isn't. You and the killer are only slightly faster than the survivors, and I mean this marginally. If you take one small turn off they will have grown the lead. You can spend an entire match chasing a single person in circles and never hit them. Which brings us to the next issue, as the killer it takes two hits to down someone. The reach of your weapon is very small, you have to be right on top of someone to hit them. This combined with the fact that you are only a percent faster than the survivors means good luck actually getting a hit.

Each map is essentially a square, with various objects inside it, none of which you can really interact with. Every map feels the same, and are devoid of any interesting features for either the survivors to use or the killer.

There is potential here, if some of these issues could be fixed. Starting with making the killer something to be feared. I could go on but I've already given this more time then I would like.

A really fun game, both alone and with friends. But though I haven't been playing all that much yet, there seems to be one flaw that might damage it in the long run: the lack of killers. When I play survivor alone I get a queue time sometimes over 10 mins, if I get to a lobby at all. As killer I get a match within ten seconds.

There are probably many reasons for this problem, but the biggest one imo is the community. Firstly, when you get into a match as a new(b) killer, the first thing you notice in the after-game lobby screen is that all the survivors are 15+, most of them lvl 25. This gives the survivors an unfair experience advantage both in perks and knowledge about the game.

Secondly, the survivors can be toxic as fuck. Just today after one match I've heard words like "autistic", "retard", "not bad. really fucking bad" and so on. And these are the 25+ players. Sure, when you lose you can write stuff like "fcuking camper" and so on, but at least you are kicking up. Kicking down on a player that has lost is just untasteful and ruins any potential for new killers.

 I've also noticed that the killers are a lot nicer than the survivors. Writing stuff like "gg" and "thx for the game" and "well played" and doing things like helping you if you're new by letting new players finish generators and escape or guide/carry the newb to the hatch.

All in all good game. Too bad the community is killing it. *ehm* Left for dead 2 *ehm*
